questions.question_text: A user received an alert from a Windows computer indicating low storage space. Which of the following will best resolve this issue?

discussion.content:
B. Running Disk Cleanup
Disk Cleanup is a built-in Windows tool that scans your hard drive and identifies files and programs that can be safely removed to free up disk space. It can help to remove temporary files, system files, and other unnecessary items that may be taking up space.

While increasing memory can improve system performance, it won't directly address the issue of low storage space. The other options, such as reviewing system information, editing the registry, and checking the Performance Monitor, are not directly relevant to resolving low storage space issues.

Google Gemini

comments.content: Memory and storage are completely separate things. Memory/RAM is what allows your system to pull stuff from your storage when it is in use. Disk cleanup is used to clear junk files from storage.

discussion.content: why would it be running disk cleanup as opposed to adding more memory

Selected Answer: B
The question didn't say the password wasn't complex, it just said the same password. So in my opinion, password expiration policy should be the proper option.

Selected Answer: B
b just seems more right in this instance if the question had even mention complex then maybe c aswell but in this pecffic instance im saying B
B, it could be the same complex password in each application.

questions.question_text: An employee has been using the same password for multiple applications and websites for the past several years. Which of the following would be best to prevent security issues?

comments.content:
Here's why the other options are not suitable:

* **AES (Advanced Encryption Standard):** AES is an encryption algorithm used to secure data transmission. It's not an authentication protocol and doesn't provide user authentication.
* **TKIP (Temporal Key Integrity Protocol):** TKIP is an older Wi-Fi encryption standard that has been superseded by more secure protocols like WPA2 and WPA3. It's not recommended for use in modern networks.
* **WPA3:** While WPA3 is a strong security protocol, it doesn't directly address the requirement of using existing network credentials for Wi-Fi authentication. 

RADIUS, on the other hand, is specifically designed for centralized authentication, authorization, and accounting. It allows the organization to enforce consistent security policies and manage user access to the Wi-Fi network.

Google Gemini

discussion.content:
B. RADIUS
RADIUS (Remote Authentication Dial-In User Service) is a network protocol that provides centralized authentication, authorization, and accounting (AAA) services. It can be used to authenticate users against a corporate directory, such as Active Directory, allowing them to use their existing network credentials to log in to the Wi-Fi network. This provides a seamless and secure authentication experience for users.   


Google Gemini

B
Remote Authentication Dial-in User Service = RADIUS

questions.question_text: A technician is deploying a new Wi-Fi solution for the office and wants to ensure users can log in to the Wi-Fi with their existing network log-in and password. Which of the following methods should the technician use?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
If you are choosing A, what are you reverting back to if you are just now enabling system restore?

A. Enable System Restore.
System Restore is a built-in Windows feature that allows you to restore your system to a previous point in time. If the BSOD was caused by a recent Windows update, using System Restore to revert to a previous restore point can often resolve the issue.

This is a less invasive solution than reinstalling the OS or rolling back device drivers.

Google Gemini

comments.content: but not having it on before you started the update means you have nothing to go back to

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Problem is with the Windows update, OS updates have nothing to do with device drivers. Answer should be A, use System Restore to go back to before the update.

I realized it is possible to roll-back device Drivers

Answer is B

questions.question_text: A technician is troubleshooting a Windows 10 PC that has experienced a BSOD. The user recently installed optional Windows updates. Which of the following is best way to resolve the issue?

A user clicked a link in an email, and now the cursor is moving around on its own. A technician notices that File Explorer is open and data is being copied from the local drive to an unknown cloud storage location. Which of the following should the technician do first?

choices.C: Educate the user about dangerous links.

discussion.content:
D. Quarantine the workstation.
The first priority is to isolate the infected workstation to prevent the malware from spreading to other devices on the network. Once the workstation is quarantined, the technician can proceed with further investigation, such as running anti-malware software and educating the user about safe online practices.

Google Gemini

Selected Answer: D
in cases of malware or most kinds of things like this the first step would be to isolate the computer so the other devices on the network don't get infected as well
